title: Achieve sustainable development but not by bulldozing forests: Supreme Court tells Telangana
content: “I am myself an advocate for sustainable development, but that doesn’t mean that overnight you should employ 30 bulldozers and clear all the jungle,” Chief Justice Gavai said

title: Railways to launch portal for Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members to book reserved tickets online
content: The development of software for booking reserved tickets online by sitting as well as former Parliamentarians has been taken up. This will facilitate them to book/cancel the ticket online as per their convenience

title: What India needs from U.K. is another FTA — Fugitive Transfer Agreement: Congress’ dig at government
content: Congress said that what India needs from U.K. is the announcement of another and more effective FTA — Fugitive Transfer Agreement

title: Dam on upper reaches Brahmaputra will not impact India, Bangladesh: China
content: Playing down the concerns of the lower riparian states, the Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said that they have cooperated with India and Bangladesh by sharing hydrological data, flood prevention, disaster alleviation

title: Devendra Fadnavis to inaugurate Kusumagaraj Marathi language centre at JNU
content: Maharashtra government wants to construct an equestrian statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in JNU campus

title: Thousands in Kerala offer ‘bali tharpanam’ on Karkidaka Vavu Bali to honour ancestors and departed souls
content: Hundreds, including senior citizens, women and children, thronged beachfronts, riversides, and bathing ghats under an overcast sky, revering their ancestors and the recently dead

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 4 LIVE: Congress moves adjournment motion to discuss Special Intensive Revision
content: Opposition parties are set to protest again at the Parliament premises against the ongoing Special Intensive Revision in Bihar

title: Opposition may boycott Bihar poll, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: The RJD leader alleged the Election Commission is for “working at the behest of BJP and ruling NDA” and might boycott the polls after taking feedback from people and alliance partners

title: India sends burn injury specialists to Bangladesh to assist air crash survivors
content: Two burn injury specialists and a nursing assistant from India’s topmost burn injury hospitals – Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and Safdarjung Hospital – reached Dhaka to help the injured

title: India's mobile phone exports rise 127 times to ₹2 lakh crore in 10 years
content: Minister of State for Electronics and IT Jitin Prasada said that 75% of the total mobile phone demand in India was met through imports in 2014-15, which has now dropped to 0.02% in 2024-25

title: Damned if they do, or don’t: AIADMK’s impossible choice on alliance with BJP
content: The regional party’s tie up with the BJP offers possible short-term gains but comes with the risk of losing identity and voter base

title: India, China review border situation, prepare for Special Representatives dialogue
content: The MEA said India and China prepared for the next round of the Special Representatives' talks on the boundary issue to be held in India later this year

title: Phone assembly domestic value addition is 23%, new report claims
content: The report by the Centre for Development Studies, Thiruvananthapuram, counters existing assessments of domestic value addition in mobile phone assembly

title: BJP partner TIPRA Motha demands Bihar-like SIR in Tripura
content: A delegation of the party, headed by its founder Pradyot Kishore Manikya, demanded an extensive survey to identify the illegal voters on the electoral rolls

title: India’s press and media ecosystem expands with over 1.55 lakh publications and 908 private TV channels: govt.
content: The number of private satellite TV channels have also increased from 821 in 2014-15 to 908 in 2024-25, govt said

title: Former Trinamool MP Jawhar Sircar demands “answers” for animals missing from Alipore Zoo
content: Wildlife enthusiasts of the city express concerns over “disappearance” of hundreds of creatures from Kolkata’s famous Alipore Zoo and the e-auction of a part of the zoo land

title: Andhra Pradesh poised to emerge as a model for other States in agrivoltaics, says NSEF CEO
content: Combining solar energy with farming can not only provide farmers with an additional source of income but also help them in adapting to changing climate conditions, thereby ensuring sustainable growth in the two sectors, says Subrahmanyam

title: Rajasthan formulating five-year plan for domestic piped natural gas supply infrastructure
content: The supply of cooking gas for domestic consumption through underground pipelines is a relatively new concept in Rajasthan

title: AI Express plane aborts takeoff at Delhi airport due to technical snag
content: The source said that the pilot decided to abort takeoff as there was a glitch with the screens displaying the speed parameters in the cockpit

title: More Nagaland bodies brace for influx of people evicted in Assam
content: The Konyak Students’ Union wants its volunteers to guard the interstate border against possible movement of people

title: ED attaches shares worth ₹127 crore in case linked to ex-Trinamool MP
content: Alchemist firms allegedly raised ₹1,848 crore from unsuspecting investors and later misappropriated the funds

title: Left parties hold procession against the harassment of W.B. migrants in other States
content: Calcutta High Court directed the Odisha government to file an affidavit in opposition to the contentions in habeas corpus petitions that two Bengali-speaking migrant workers from West Bengal were illegally detained in the neighbouring State

title: Himachal CM asks Centre to expedite matters pertaining to State’s civil aviation sector
content: The Chief Minister has urged the Ministry to recommend the proposed expansion of the airport in the State’s Kangra

title: Services under ‘Snehagramam’ project for endosulfan victims enter second phase
content: Snehagramam is being developed on 25 acres provided by the Planatation Corporation as compensation in Muliyar grama panchayat

title: Female trainee constables protest at U.P.’s Gorakhpur centre over basic amenities, abusive language, cameras
content: While administrative officers dispersed the protestors who were blocking the road and directed them back inside the centre, the recruits protested outside the administrative building, demanding addressing of their basic demands

title: Kauvery Hospital opens specialised HCM clinic at its facility in Vadapalani
content: The clinic aims to streamline access, improve clinical outcomes and offer focused, affordable care for a complex condition that often requires cross-specialty coordination.

title: Modi begins U.K. visit, trade deal to be inked today
content: The deal would boost trade between the two countries by £25.5 billion each year, a U.K. government statement said

title: Residents of localities along ECR complain that civic works have turned many roads slushy
content: The common complaint is that the roads were cut for only about 5 ft width, but, the dug up earth was piled and left alongside.

title: Former Deputy CM Dushyant Chautala criticises Haryana’s law and order under Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini
content: Mr. Chautala said that Mr. Saini seemed to have “no control over the police” and the law-and-order situation had deteriorated after he took over as the Home Minister

title: Packers: Received $432.6M in revenue sharing
content: The Packers, the NFL's only publicly owned team, revealed Wednesday that the national revenue sharing from the previous fiscal year was a record $432.6 million.

title: Griner honored in Phoenix return as Dream win
content: In her first game back in Phoenix, where she played 11 seasons and won a title, Brittney Griner had 17 points to lead the Dream to a 90-79 win on Wednesday night.

title: Rays option Bradley to minors after rough start
content: The Rays optioned Taj Bradley to Triple-A Durham following a poor start for the inconsistent right-hander Wednesday night.

title: Clean slate: Rockies get 1st shutout in 221 games
content: Rookie right-hander Tanner Gordon led the way as the Rockies recorded their first shutout in 221 games, ending the third-longest streak without one in MLB history.

title: USC freshman Arenas injures knee, out 6-8 months
content: USC freshman Alijah Arenas, who was the No. 13 recruit in the ESPN 100, will need surgery after injuring his knee and will sit out six to eight months, the school announced.

title: Ohtani ties Dodgers' mark with HR in 5th straight
content: Shohei Ohtani homered for the fifth consecutive game, becoming the seventh player in Dodgers franchise history to accomplish that feat.

title: Aggies' collie mascot has surgery to remove eye
content: Reveille X, Texas A&M's beloved collie mascot, was resting comfortably after having her right eye surgically removed after being diagnosed with glaucoma.

title: Passan's ultimate MLB trade deadline preview: Where all 30 teams stand, best fits and latest intel
content: From the contenders to the rebuilders, here's what every front office is thinking ahead of the July 31 deadline.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: NBA rebuild rankings: How close 14 teams are to title contention
content: Is Dallas' rebuild already complete? How close is San Antonio? We examine the paths forward for 14 teams that missed the playoffs.

title: The worst decision every NBA team has made over the past five years, ranked 30 to 1
content: Zach Kram examines the deals, trades and picks that all 30 NBA teams would like to take back from the 2020s.

title: Bonmatí's star power shines through as Spain see off Germany -- just barely
content: Aitana Bonmatí struck an extra-time winner to send Spain into Sunday's Euro 2025 final against England at the expense of eight-time winners Germany.

title: England's late show stuns Italy as super-subs seal final spot
content: England's super-subs saved the day with minutes to go against Italy as the Lionesses snuck into the Euro final.

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

content: Shohei Ohtani has ramped up his workload since making his pitching debut as a Dodger back on June 16, but what can we expect out of him for the rest of the season?

title: Manchester United's U.S. preseason tour: Amorim's goals, players to watch
content: Manchester United and Ruben Amorim have arrived in the U.S. aiming to lay the groundwork for a rebound after a dismal 2024-25 campaign.

title: Bonmati: Spain had intel on Berger for winner
content: Spain's match-winner Aitana Bonmatí said she knew Germany goalkeeper Ann-Katrin Berger would leave space at her near post after scoring the goal which sets up a European Championship final against England on Sunday.

title: Rashford joins Barcelona: 'Feels like I'm at home'
content: Barcelona have completed the signing of Manchester United and England forward Marcus Rashford on a season-long loan, the Catalan club confirmed

title: Garber: MLS won't rush 'seismic' calendar shift
content: MLS commissioner Don Garber reiterated that a change to the league's calendar will not likely come until after the 2026 World Cup, insisting that a "seismic" shift like that would take time to implement.

title: Chicharito fined amid backlash over sexist remarks
content: Chivas striker Javier "Chicharito" Hernandez has been fined following an investigation by Mexico's federation into sexist remarks he made online.

title: Cameroon coach not quitting, blames email hack
content: Marc Brys has denied he has quit as coach of Cameroon despite the country's football federation confirming his exit on Wednesday, as the Belgian said his email was likely hacked.

title: Barça cancel Japan friendly citing contract breach
content: Barcelona have suspended the Japan part of this month's Asia tour due to what the club said was a serious breach of contract by the promoter.

title: Odunze, McCarthy among favorite breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Scheffler's dominance, players to watch and how the Ryder Cup teams look
content: What's next for Scottie Scheffler? Who are the locks for Bethpage, and who has work to do? Following The Open, we look ahead to the rest of the 2025 golf season.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: Most of the NHL free agent deals are handed out July 1. But there are still some players left -- here are the top remaining unrestricted free agents.

title: Jets go high-tech (and old-school) with locker room redesign
content: A barbershop, along with customized video screens and lockers give the Jets' new locker room a modern-meets-retro feel.

title: Betting buzz: Dallas Cowboys' season win total lowest since 2003
content: The Cowboys' win total for this season has dropped to 7.5 at ESPN BET, the lowest preseason win total for a Cowboys team since 2003.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Transfer rumors, news: LAFC plot move for Spurs star Son
content: Son Heung-Min, 33, has been linked with a move to MLS side LAFC. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Buyer beware: The gamble MLS clubs make with designated players
content: The opening of the transfer window offers a reminder that signing a big-name player won't cut it in MLS these days.

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: Bihar police lathi charge on protesting Jan Suraaj workers in Patna, many get injured
content: Losing cool over police action, party founder Prashant Kishor said he will make it difficult for the government to function even for a day

title: Parliamentary panel faults Centre’s move to disengage 7-decade-old NIRDPR
content: The reputed autonomous organisation has been known for its expertise in building capacities of rural development functionaries, elected representatives, financial institutions and community-based organisations

title: Consider watermelon cultivators’ plea for compensation, Madras High Court directs T.N. govt
content: They claimed to have suffered losses due to a scare created by food safety officials regarding alleged injection of chemicals to enhance colour and sweetness

title: BPCL-KR urged to consider Ayyankuzhi residents’ demand for land acquisition
content: Over 30 families remain sandwiched on a 9.4-acre strip between two major public sector units — Hindustan Organic Chemicals Limited and BPCL-KR

title: Sea fury batters Chellanam yet again
content: Worn-out seawall and geobags add to the plight of residents on the 5-km stretch between Puthenthode and Kattikadavu

title: World Food India event to begin on September 25
content: Food processing industry’s concerns about GST imposed on the sector are “right”, says Union Minister for Food Processing Chirag Paswan; promises to be a bridge between industry and GST Council

title: Fraud vitiates proceedings, Supreme Court recalls 2022 ruling
content: Bench invokes inherent powers to annul earlier judgment after finding fraud and suppression of facts by litigant

title: For now, Karnataka High Court allows levying fee for building plan sanction based on guidance value
content: The bench made it clear that the BBMP will have to refund the fees that it collects during the pendency of the proceedings if the final judgement on the appeal goes against the BBMP

title: Puja Khedkar’s non-creamy layer OBC certificate cancelled; she launches challenge
content: Her father declared property valued at ₹40 crore in an election affidavit filed during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls

title: Over 4.7 lakh pirated NCERT textbooks seized since 2024: Education Ministry tells Rajya Sabha
content: The information was shared by Union Minister of State for Education Jayant Chaudhary in a written reply in the Upper House.

title: J&K leaders demand Statehood, decry Pulwama, Pahalgam ‘security failures’
content: The Assembly elections were held in the Union Territory of J&K in September 2024 but restoration of Statehood, an assurance given by the Union Government to the Supreme Court, is yet to be done

title: ₹29,353 crore spent to upgrade railway infrastructure in Bihar so far, says Vaishnaw
content: The Minister said that Bihar’s railway budget has seen a nine-fold rise in 11 years, and key river bridges such as Munger, Patna and Kosi have been completed

title: ED arrests three in ₹1,000 crore real estate fraud case
content: Promoters of Universal Buildwell accused of diverting funds from homebuyers across eight projects in Gurugram and Faridabad

title: Navy chief hails 100th indigenous ship as symbol of maritime self-reliance
content: Admiral Tripathi spoke of the Indian Navy’s Vision 2047 to transform into an ‘Aatmanirbhar’ force through leadership-driven focus on innovation, indigenisation, and integration of niche, disruptive, and emerging technologies

title: Karnataka High Court asks BMRCL to consider plea for metro station at Bettahalasur cross on airport line
content: On enquiry made through RTI, the petitioner came to know that the plan of station at Bettahalasur cross was dropped as a private company, Embassy Group, had backed out from sponsoring the station as was agreed earlier

title: Defence Secretary holds bilateral meeting with Director General of Israeli Ministry of Defence
content: The two sides agreed to work towards developing an institutional framework for further deepening of defence ties

title: DD Free Dish expands reach with greater representation of languages from southern States
content: Union Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting said DD Free Dish had experienced consistent growth in its reach over the past few years

title: ED attaches property worth ₹5.87 crore in medical PG student stipend scam in Karnataka
content: The accused allegedly embezzled stipend meant for post-graduate medical students by obtaining blank signed post-dated cheques from students in advance and withdrew the stipend credited to the accounts of students

title: Plea in Supreme Court seeks removal of MP Minister for ‘nauseating’ remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi
content: In the May 19 hearing, Justice Kant had remarked that the Minister’s comments amounted to “crass, thoughtless remarks”. The court said there was no point apologising to the court merely to “wriggle out of a situation”

title: Tom Aspinall booked his first title defense, but is it the right matchup?
content: The UFC 320 and UFC 321 headliners have been announced. Brett Okamoto reacts to the three upcoming title fights.

title: Pound for pound: Shakur, 'Bam' Rodriguez move up after exciting wins
content: Oleksandr Usyk is still No. 1, but where do Shakur Stevenson and Jesse Rodriguez land? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Divisional: Pacquiao reenters welterweight top 10
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Fewer foreign trips, protocol lapses upset Jagdeep Dhankhar; former Vice-President felt he had a diminished role
content: Differences over MEA assignments amongst reasons for the discord between the former Vice-President and government; Mr. Dhankhar felt his role was less than that of his predecessors, say sources

title: Kerala bids tearful farewell to V.S. Achuthanandan
content: Former Chief Minister and senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader V.S. Achuthanandan was cremated with full State honours at the Punnapra-Vayalar Martyrs’ Memorial at Valiya Chudukkad at 9.15 p.m., on the very soil that shaped his life and struggles

title: Telangana argues for restriction of diversion for KC Canal system by A.P.
content: Resuming final arguments before KWDT-II, counsel for TG urges Tribunal for telemetry at Banakacherla Cross Regulator too

title: Home Ministry begins moving out of British-era North Block
content: It is shifting to Common Central Secretariat building on Janpath; Once all offices move out of North and South Blocks, these will be turned into a museum

title: First exports from BBP: Four Asian elephants head to Japan
content: The exchange is a part of a larger multi exchange programme, where in return, the park will receive four cheetahs, four jaguars, four pumas, three chimpanzees and eight black-capped capuchins

title: Trump's First Five Trade Deals Ahead Of August 1 Deadline
content: Japan and the Philippines take to five the number of countries that have concluded trade deals with the United States ahead of an August 1 deadline set by President Donald Trump to avoid punitive tariff rates.

title: Russia Knew Of Hillary Clinton's "Psycho-Emotional" Issues During 2016 Polls
content: Russia allegedly had damaging intelligence about former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's "psycho-emotional problems" during her 2016 presidential campaign against Donald Trump, according to a newly declassified intelligence report.

title: Russia Knew Of Hillary Clinton's "Psycho-Emotional" Issues During 2016 Polls
content: Russia allegedly had damaging intelligence about former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's "psycho-emotional problems" during her 2016 presidential campaign against Donald Trump, according to a newly declassified intelligence report.

title: Kirron Kher Gets Rs 12 Lakh Notice Over Unpaid Government House Licence Fee
content: Former BJP MP Kirron Kher has been issued a notice seeking payment of Rs 12.76 lakh in dues as licence fee for a government-allotted house in Chandigarh.

title: The Dhankhar Conundrum: The Tide That Turned - And How
content: When Jagdeep Dhankhar became Vice President in 2022, he was seen as a staunch supporter of the Modi government, as a loud, loyal, shrewd politician-cum-administrator who could take on the Opposition and the judiciary.

title: 'Next Vice President From BJP': Party Sources Trash Nitish Kumar Buzz
content: The next Vice President will be a veteran leader from the BJP, top sources in the party have told NDTV, ruling out speculation that the BJP may consider key allies, such as JDU chief Nitish Kumar

title: "Hope To Live Up To Expectations": Kamal Haasan Set For Parliament Debut
content: Actor-turned-politician and Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) chief Kamal Haasan is all set to be sworn in as a Rajya Sabha MP on Thursday.

title: Hindu Temple In Australia's Melbourne Defaced With Racist Graffiti
content: A Hindu temple in Melbourne was defaced with hateful slurs demanding, "Go Home Brown C**t", in the latest incident of racism in Australia.

title: Kanwar Yatra 2025: Delhi Police Issues Traffic Advisory For July 21-23
content: In the advisory, the police stated that the GT Road, from Apsara Border to Shahdara, Seemapuri to Apsara Border, Anand Vihar to Apsara Border, and the GT Road to Vivek Vihar Underpass will remain closed from July 21-23.

title: Worm Found Inside Food At Rameshwaram Cafe At Bengaluru Airport
content: A worm was found inside a dish that was served to a customer at an outlet of the popular Rameshwaram Cafe, at the Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru on Thursday morning.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 4 Live: Parliament To Discuss Merchant Shipping Bill, Coastal Shipping
content: Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal will move The Readjustment of Representation of Scheduled Tribes in Assembly Constituencies of the State of Goa Bill, 2024, for consideration and passage.

title: 2 Tamil Nadu Hospitals Lose Transplant Licences Over Alleged Kidney Racket
content: In a major crackdown on a suspected kidney transplantation racket, the Tamil Nadu government has suspended the kidney transplant licences of two private hospitals following a preliminary probe conducted by the state health department.

title: "We're Not Surprised": White House Responds To Latest Trump-Epstein Claim
content: With a new report claiming that US President Donald Trump knew his name was present in case files related to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, the White House on Wednesday pulled out all the stops to redirect public attention.

title: PM Modi Lands In UK, Long-Awaited Free Trade Deal Expected Today: 10 Points
content: PM Narendra Modi is on his fourth visit to the UK since taking office in 2014 and will hold talks with UK PM Keir Starmer on issues such as trade, health, energy, education and security.

title: Probe Agency ED Attaches Rs 127 Crore Worth Shares Against Ex-Trinamool MP's Son
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday said it has provisionally attached more than Rs 127 crore worth of shares "beneficially owned" by the son of former Trinamool Congress MP and businessman Kanwar Deep Singh in a money laundering case.

title: Video: Horses Fight In Madhya Pradesh, One Leaps Into Rickshaw And Gets Stuck
content: The horses began fighting furiously at the busy Nagrath Chowk on Wednesday, ignoring attempts by locals to chase them away. In the chaos, the animals barged into a nearby showroom, damaging property, before their fight spilled back onto the road.

title: Rs 27 Lakh For 1-Hour Bike Rally At Madhya Pradesh Event? Activists Seek Probe
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Dr Mohan Yadav played a key role in the formation of Ratapani Tiger Reserve, spread across Raisen and Sehore districts in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Trump Was Told He Is In Epstein Files: Report
content: U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi told President Donald Trump in May that his name appeared in investigative files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

title: Railways Sanctions Rs 1.9 Lakh Crore Projects In 4 Years: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: A total of 237 projects of a total length of 9,703 kms -- costing about Rs 1,90,333 crore -- have been sanctioned across Indian Railways during the last three fiscals and the current financial year to date, the Parliament was informed on Wednesday.

title: India's Mobile Phone Exports Rise 127 Times To Rs 2 lakh Crore In 10 Years
content: Export of mobile phones from India increased by 127 times to reach Rs 2 lakh crore in the last 10 financial years, Parliament was informed on Wednesday.

title: Bengaluru terror alert: How alert bus stand worker blew lid off CM event bomb plot
content: Just days before a high-profile event with the CM and deputy CM in attendance, Bengaluru police were alerted to an abandoned bag containing six gelatine sticks and detonators at a private bus stand in KR Market. The discovery, made by a toilet in-charge, prompted an extensive search by the anti-sabotage squad, though no further explosives were found.

title: Second hate attack in 2 days: Hindu temple defaced in Australia with racist graffiti
content: A Hindu temple and Asian-operated businesses in Melbourne were defaced with racist graffiti, sparking a police investigation into hate-motivated attacks. The incidents, condemned by authorities and community leaders, are being treated as linked. This follows a separate racist assault in Adelaide, where an Indian man was brutally attacked after being told to "f--- off, Indian."

title: Ammonia leak scare in Mumbai: 3,000kg tank's faulty valve triggers major alert
content: A ammonia gas leak occurred at Mahananda Dairy in Goregaon. The leak came from a tank due to a faulty valve. Authorities responded quickly to contain the situation. The electrical supply was cut off as a precaution. Fire brigade and HAZMAT teams worked to stop the leak. The area was cordoned off for safety.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You don't get carted off if ...' – Ex-England captain on Pant's injury
content: Rishabh Pant's injury scare has cast a shadow over India's fourth Test hopes at Old Trafford. A painful blow to his right foot forced him to retire hurt, raising concerns about his further participation in the game and potentially the series.

title: Cyber threat spike: Microsoft on Chinese hackers; SharePoint ransomware surge puts firms at risk
content: Microsoft is warning organizations about active exploitation of on-premises SharePoint servers by the Storm-2603 group. Hackers are deploying Warlock ransomware after breaching vulnerable systems, demanding cryptocurrency payments. SharePoint Online is unaffected, but on-premises versions require patching. Microsoft advises enabling AMSI, deploying Defender AV, and monitoring for suspicious activity to protect against these attacks.

title: 'Backdoor sabotage': Siddaramaiah slams Goa CM over remarks on Mahadayi project
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has strongly criticized Goa CM Pramod Sawant's remarks regarding the Mahadayi river water project, deeming them an insult to the people of Karnataka. Karnataka vows to fight for its rightful share of the project legally, politically, and morally, emphasizing the project's importance for North Karnataka's drinking water needs.

title: India at UN backs two-state solution in Gaza; calls for hostage release
content: India has called for renewed dialogue and diplomacy to achieve peace in the Middle East, emphasizing that temporary pauses in hostilities are insufficient. Addressing the UN Security Council, Ambassador Harish Parvathaneni stressed the need for a ceasefire, release of hostages, and a two-state solution.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock sends 'China diktat' to employees
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: Why are US-funded contraceptives being burned in France?
content: A stockpile of US-funded contraceptives, valued at nearly $10 million and intended for developing countries, is set to be destroyed in France. The decision follows the US government's rejection of offers to repurpose the supplies, which have been sitting unused since a Trump-era foreign aid freeze.

title: Landmark ICJ verdict on climate change: Inaction by nations is illegal
content: The International Court of Justice says countries may break international law by not protecting the climate. The court opened the door for reparations to affected countries. The UN general assembly asked the ICJ for its opinion in 2023. The court said everyone has a right to a healthy environment. Experts say this could shape future lawsuits and climate policies.

title: From Tulsi with love: Obama's Russia intel under fire; Trump gets new ammunition
content: This week, Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard blew the dust off a long-suppressed House Intelligence Committee report that takes aim at one of the most sacred narratives of American liberal orthodoxy: that Russia wanted Donald Trump to win in 2016. What Gabbard released wasn’t just a report—it was a Molotov cocktail thrown at the edifice of the Obama-era intelligence establishment.

title: Work-life blur: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to engineers; ‘When I’m not working, I’m thinking about…’
content: Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, admits his work-life balance is 'nonexistent,' dedicating nearly all his waking hours to the company. Huang's intense focus, involving envisioning Nvidia's future, is credited with the company's massive success, leading to a 1,600% stock price increase. He aims to transform Nvidia into a 'one giant AI,' believing it will eventually allow him to achieve work-life balance.

title: Dhanbad 'mine collapse': Many feared trapped; politics hots up as conflicting claims emerge
content: Concerns are rising in Dhanbad as reports surface of a potential mine collapse trapping at least twelve miners in an illegal coal mine. While authorities claim no evidence of the incident has been found, political tensions escalate with accusations flying between ruling and opposition parties regarding the prevalence of illegal mining.

title: Thai & Cambodian soldiers fire at each other; 3 civilians hurt in rocket strike: Details
content: Thai-Cambodian border sees renewed conflict. Both sides exchanged fire in a disputed zone. A Thai soldier was injured by a landmine. Thailand expelled the Cambodian ambassador. Cambodia downgraded diplomatic ties in response. Trade bans and travel restrictions are in place. Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra faces domestic pressure. A leaked call with Hun Sen further complicates the situation.

title: PM Modi lands in UK; focus on free trade agreement: What's on agenda?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in London for a two-day visit, commencing the first leg of his two-nation tour. He was warmly greeted by the Indian community and expressed gratitude for their support. Discussions with UK leaders, including Prime Minister Keir Starmer, will focus on the Free Trade Agreement, extradition of fugitives like Vijay Mallya, and concerns regarding Khalistani groups.

title: 4th Test Weather Update: Rain threat early, sunshine later as India eye fightback
content: Day 2 of the crucial India vs England fourth Test at Old Trafford faces weather uncertainties, potentially influencing the match's outcome. India, at 264/4, awaits updates on Rishabh Pant's injury sustained on Day 1. The forecast predicts a mix of overcast conditions and sunny intervals, with a slight chance of morning rain, impacting India's push for a strong first-innings total.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will yellow metal rate stay above Rs 1 lakh mark?
content: Gold prices are predicted to potentially reach ₹101,700, fueled by bullish sentiment and a COMEX Gold breakout. Silver is also expected to continue its upward trend, possibly testing ₹120,000, supported by strong demand and positive global cues. Investors should monitor key support levels and global developments for both metals.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 25,200; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday. While Nifty50 was near 25,200, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office collection day 6: Movie crosses Rs 150 crore
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara,' directed by Mohit Suri, has become a box office phenomenon, surpassing numerous major films. Despite a slight dip on Wednesday, the film has grossed over Rs 150 crore. 'Saiyaara' impressively outperformed 'Chhaava' in Delhi/UP area and even exceeded the first Tuesday collections of 'Pushpa 2' in that region, marking a significant achievement.

title: Columbia Univ to pay $200m to settle clash with Trump admin: 10 things to know
content: Columbia University has reached an agreement with the Trump administration, paying over $220 million to restore federal research funding that was previously cancelled due to antisemitism concerns. The agreement includes financial penalties, curriculum reviews, and revised disciplinary procedures.

title: IND vs ENG 4th Test : Indian openers provide sound start; England hit back
content: At Old Trafford, India opted for an extra seamer due to overcast conditions, a decision that saw Shardul Thakur included in the playing XI. Sai Sudharsan's impressive 61 stabilized the innings after Jaiswal and Rahul's solid start, but a late collapse, triggered by Pant's injury and Sudharsan's dismissal, left India at 264/4.

title: Who is Shane Taylor Rooks' husband? Mystery wedding unveiled
content: Taylor Rooks, an NBA journalist, recently celebrated her wedding. The event occurred on July 24. The groom's first name is Shane. The wedding was a private affair in New York City. Celebrities like Kevin Durant and Saquon Barkley attended. Joy Taylor was a bridesmaid. Rooks previously had relationships with Jesse Williams and Kendall Marshall. The wedding announcement surprised many people.

title: IND vs ENG: Mhatre’s ton lights up chase, but rain denies India historic win
content: Ayush Mhatre's stunning century propelled India U19 towards a thrilling victory, but rain and bad light forced a frustrating draw in the second Youth Test against England at Wormsley. Chasing a target of 355, India reached 290/6 in 43 overs, with Mhatre's 126 off 80 balls leading the charge, before the weather intervened.

title: US appeals court blocks Trump's order on birthright citizenship- What it means
content: In a significant victory for immigrants, a US court has blocked President Trump's attempt to end birthright citizenship, deeming it unconstitutional. The ruling, delivered by the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, upholds the 14th Amendment, ensuring that children born in the US to non-citizen parents on short term visas are still granted citizenship.

title: ‘Thrown to the wolves’: American moves family to Russia; gets drafted into Ukraine war
content: An American father, Derek Huffman, seeking traditional values, relocated his family from Texas to Russia, disillusioned by perceived 'wokeness' in US schools. Lured by promises of a non-combat role and expedited citizenship, Huffman joined the Russian military. However, he now finds himself near the Ukraine front lines, despite lacking military experience and adequate Russian language skills.

title: Rolls-Royces bought from Big B and Aamir Khan trigger tax storm for 'KGF Babu'
content: Bengaluru-based realtor Yusuf Sharif, also known as KGF Babu, faced a tax bill of nearly Rs 40 lakh for operating luxury Rolls-Royce cars, previously owned by Amitabh Bachchan and Aamir Khan, in Karnataka without paying the required state taxes.

title: Dhankar's resignation: BJP to use oppn’s own words to foil attack over veep’s exit
content: As the opposition seemingly prepares to leverage Jagdeep Dhankhar's unexpected resignation against the government, the ruling party is poised to counter with reminders of the opposition's past criticisms of the former Vice President, including accusations of bias and acting as a government spokesperson.

title: 'Doesn't look good': Ponting fears serious injury as Pant's scans keep India on edge
content: India's Rishabh Pant suffered a painful foot injury during the fourth Test against England, casting a shadow over their campaign. After being struck on his right foot, Pant was visibly in agony and unable to put weight on it, raising concerns about a potential metatarsal injury.

title: East Ladakh's Nyoma airfield set to be operational by October
content: India is set to complete the Mudh airfield upgrade in Ladakh by October, significantly boosting military capabilities near the Line of Actual Control with China. The upgraded airfield, one of the world's highest, will accommodate all types of aircraft and serve as a crucial forward staging ground.

title: Rishabh Pant injury: Former England captain says - 'It's 10 vs 11 now'
content: Following Rishabh Pant's foot injury during the fourth Test, Michael Vaughan suggested allowing substitutions for clear injuries to maintain competitive balance. Alastair Cook disagreed, raising concerns about potential abuse with less severe injuries like bruises. Pant sustained the injury while attempting a reverse sweep, leading to his retirement and raising questions about substitution rules.

title: Pant Injury Recap: ‘He was in a lot of pain’ — Watch dramatic video from Manchester Test
content: Rishabh Pant's innings was cut short on Day 1 of the fourth Test against England after a painful blow to his right foot while attempting a reverse-sweep. Scans were immediately conducted, and the BCCI is monitoring his progress. His injury has rattled the Indian camp, with Sai Sudharsan expressing concern. Liam Dawson from the England side also showed empathy.

title: 'Comrade Labubu': Chinese doll makes its way to Karl Marx’s grave in London
content: A Labubu figurine placed on Karl Marx's tomb in London sparked online debate, highlighting the irony of a capitalist toy on the grave of a communist icon. This incident underscores the growing trend of necrotourism, where cemeteries like Highgate are becoming cultural hotspots.

title: Spirit of the game row: DK defends Gill, shuts down Nasser - 'The issue was ...'
content: Shubman Gill recently criticized England's "spirit of the game" following a delay in their batsmen taking the field during the Lord's Test. Nasser Hussain questioned Gill's comments, but Dinesh Karthik defended Gill, emphasizing that the issue was the delay, not actions during the over.

title: WSJ claims Trump was told in May that his name was in Epstein Files multiple times
content: The Wall Street Journal reported that Attorney General Pam Bondi informed President Trump in May that his name appeared in Epstein documents. The report also mentioned other high-profile figures were named, with files containing unverified hearsay. The White House dismissed this report as fake news.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for July 24 - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha suggests a consolidation phase for Nifty between 24800 and 25320, anticipating a potential breakout led by Nifty IT. Bank Nifty's breakout above 57100 indicates continued outperformance with targets set for new all-time highs. Top stock picks include Balkrishna Industries, Sona BLW Precision Forgings, and Hindalco, each exhibiting bullish patterns and breakout confirmations.

title: Theatre legend Ratan Thiyam passes away at 77: Tributes pour in for the Manipuri maestro
content: India mourns Ratan Thiyam, the celebrated theatre director. He died at the age of 77 in Imphal. Thiyam was known for blending Manipuri tradition with modern theatre. He received the Padma Shri and other awards. Political leaders and artists are paying tribute. They remember his contribution to Indian theatre and Manipuri culture. His legacy will continue to inspire future generations.

title: IND vs ENG: Stokes breaks bowling record as England push for series win
content: Ben Stokes showcased his unwavering commitment to England by surpassing his previous record for most overs bowled in a Test series during the fourth match against India. Despite past hamstring injuries, the 34-year-old captain's tireless efforts with the ball helped check India's progress. His dedication contrasts with workload management debates, setting a strong example for his team.

title: India-UK FTA: Duty cut hopes dent luxury car bookings
content: The impending India-United Kingdom trade agreement, poised to slash import duties on luxury cars to 10%, has disrupted the Indian luxury car market. Wealthy customers are delaying or cancelling orders, anticipating lower prices. Dealers face frustration and potential losses as brands may divert production to other markets, while advising customers on potential price increases and delayed implementation.

title: SC asks Karnataka, Centre to act on 5 tigers' death
content: The Supreme Court has sought a response from the Karnataka government regarding the death of five tigers in the MM Hills sanctuary. The incident, attributed to villagers poisoning a carcass consumed by the tigers, highlights the escalating human-animal conflict. The court directed the Union environment ministry to formulate a policy, in consultation with states, to address this issue.

title: Bihar SIR: With 2 days still to go, 56 lakh voters already struck off rolls
content: With the deadline looming for enumeration form submissions in Bihar, the Election Commission has identified a significant number of discrepancies. Approximately one lakh electors are untraceable, and an additional 55 lakh are reported as deceased, permanently migrated, or enrolled in multiple locations.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle opens up about choosing surrogacy
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: Connor’s next team decided? One Stanley Cup contender has the edge
content: Speculation surrounds Connor McDavid's future with the Edmonton Oilers as contract extension talks remain stalled. NHL insider Chris Johnston suggests that while Edmonton is still the frontrunner, teams with ample cap space and a clear path to championship contention could lure the NHL superstar if he explores free agency in 2026.

title: Travis Kelce makes 'emotional' career decision off the field
content: Amidst family health concerns, Taylor Swift finds unwavering support in Travis Kelce as her father, Scott Swift, recovers from heart surgery. Kelce's commitment shines through, with reports indicating he took on significant responsibilities during this challenging time. Simultaneously, Kelce's professional commitments continue as he prepares for training camp, leading to adjustments in his podcast schedule with brother Jason.

title: Court says relationship consensual, grants bail to Mumbai school teacher
content: A Mumbai court granted bail to a teacher accused of sexually assaulting a male student, citing evidence of a subsequent consensual relationship after the victim turned 17 and the teacher resigned. The court acknowledged the victim's fears of manipulation but imposed strict conditions, forbidding the teacher from contacting or threatening the victim or witnesses.

title: India develops personnel sphere, completes welding on submersible after 700 trials
content: The Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro) has achieved a milestone in India's Deep Ocean Mission by successfully developing the personnel sphere for the MATSYA-6000 submersible. This vessel is designed to carry humans to depths of 6,000 meters. The accomplishment involved overcoming challenges in welding thick titanium plates, marking a significant advancement for underwater exploration and resource assessment.

title: No evidence to back statement of Odisha girl 'set on fire': Cops
content: Odisha police are investigating a case where a 15-year-old girl claimed she was set on fire by three men in Puri. However, initial investigations, including CCTV footage analysis and witness statements, have not corroborated her account of the incident.

title: Zubimendi joined Arsenal after rejecting Liverpool. Can he end their title wait?
content: arsenal manager Mikel Arteta believes new signing Martn Zubimendi joins the club . the club's away kit launch on Monday took place at NOVA Rooftop in Singapore . it is the only tangible improvement they can make after three consecutive second-place finishes in the premier league .

title: Browns unveil new 'Alpha Dawg' helmets, will don in three regular-season games
content: the helmet, called "Alpha Dawg," will be worn three times in the upcoming 2025 season . the helmet features an all-brown matte shell with a brown stripe between two orange stripes in the middle . it's the first timothy robertson helmet to be worn in the 2025 .

content: WNBA star caitlin Clark surprised the Iowa Hawkeyes men's and women's basketball teams . she has consistently sported the Kobe Bryant signature shoe since her college days at Iowa . "it's not eve," she said last season .

title: Ekitike signs for Slot's new-look Liverpool team
content: Hugo Ekitike joins arsenal from Eintracht Frankfurt . the 23-year-old is the latest signing for arne slot's revamped side this summer . sources say the move could cost them £79 million ($91m) for the striker .

title: 'I felt like I needed to smoke a cigarette sometimes': Untold NFL holdout stories
content: future Hall of Fame offensive tackle Walter Jones spotted something in a newspaper that changed everything about his holdout in 2002 . he was trying to secure a long-term deal from the Seattle Seahawks . but he read something that compelled him to sign a deal that same day: the amount of money he had forfeited .

content: Avishek Kumar is a city reporter at the Times of India in Noida and Ghaziabad. He reports on crime, fire, and traffic with a particular focus on civic issues. Over the course of more than five years in journalism, he covered a broad spectrum of city beats, including courts and civics. He is committed to pursuing leads and producing hard-hitting, fact-based, field-exclusive reports.
